it‚Äôs walking with a set pace for a mile

there‚Äôs nothing not true about that

First I'm checking to see if there's a problem with my system
Just did a Windows update, now I'm scanning my disk to see if there's any storage issues or corruption of the system image
Soma: Scary to play, scary to install
Breaks the 4th wall right out the gate
Nutmeg is a weird seasoning, I always have this expectation that it‚Äôs more delicious than it is.
Apparently it's a SOMA only thing :/
Maybe because it‚Äôs normally put on delicious things and I really miss theose things, not nutmeg.
I mean, it's not like I'm blocked off completely from downloading it, but I have to keep hitting freakin' resume every other second
For a 10GB game, I'm getting 1 - 30MB every time I hit "resume"
Sounds like their hosting server is misbehaving?
Rest of your internet is okay?
Yeah, like I said, this is a SOMA only issue with steam forum posts
Good thing I have 10MB/s internet, or this would take forever...
Yeah the size of stuff is crazy these days
T e x t u r e s
Looks like most of the problems were the initial files
I'm still hitting resume, but at least I'm making real progress now before it stops again
So, after finishing the Amnesia games, pretty good~
I see they‚Äôre working on a new title too
My only critique of The Dark Descent is that sanity takes too long to recover
There are many events in the game that can knock a huge level off your sanity
Some can be avoided, some can't
Unless you pay attention to everything on a few playthroughs and figure out how much they give / take, there's no real rhyme or reason
And the amount of time it takes to recover most of your sanity is obscene.  We're talking standing in front of a candle for 5 - 10 minutes if you hit the lowest level
Oh yeah, don't think you saw this, I locked myself out of an achievement earlier
It's a good example of why if you're going to block off something later, you should make it clear that it's going to happen...
I wonder if that was intentional by the developers or an oversight like, ‚ÄúNahh, they‚Äôll never figure that out till later anyway‚Äù

The developers probably planned for players to run into the initial version, explore it fully, realize that there's no way to progress further, and then go back to the Nave and try to figure out how to lift the 2 gates blocking the other areas
But if you fully explore areas like I do, there are 2 levels on the upper level when you first enter the Nave
If you try to use them, they don't work.  You go downstairs, you can hear machinery running, and might notice a hatch in the roof near a table
You open the hatch, you see there are gears in there, but some are moving, some aren't
You can't reach it on the table alone, but if you grab a crate and put it on the table and then get on top of it, you can reach the gears and interact with them
That moves the one gear back into position and when you go back upstairs, the levers work again, and hallelujah, you can access the previously gated off areas!
If you do the side areas first, you can't finish 2 of the achievements in the game :/
There are six pieces of an orb, 3 in each area, that you collect.  And if you collect all six and try to go to the Chancel, an event triggers where 3 enemies spawn and knock you out
Yeah, sounds like an oversight, most achievements probably rely on doing certain things in a checkpointed-like order
Like once you check off all the tasks as they expected *pop* achievement
If I want to get the achievement, I'd need to load the autosave before I did one of the side areas
Once that cutscene triggers, when you return to the Chancel, the area changes and one of the bridges to a side room is destroyed
There's a note and a tinderbox that are no longer reachable, both of which are for separate achievements
I wonder if there‚Äôs forums with savedumps, so you could like load from a particular point to resume where you need to to get the achievement
I know some games let that happen
I watched a walkthrough vid so I saw what the rooms look like and what the note reads
Just kinda sad that the developers didn't think about that
Like, even though it wouldn't make sense, have a lever in the Chancel that unlocks the trap door, even through it's so far away and would make no flipping sense
Yeah at worst they could have just allowed both orders to unlock it
Or maybe, the door is blocked off and you need an item to unlock it
Yeah, they probably just didn‚Äôt think about it
I honestly don't care about the achievement because I don't want to do the Choir Hall again, lol
I miss the golden days of gaming when devs EXPECTED people would break games and find glitches and would hide eastereggs and whatnot
Lately they try and eliminate to make more ‚Äúpolished experiences‚Äù
Tell that to the guy who broke Sekiro and finished it in under 30 minutes, lmao
I‚Äôve seen some, like geometry glitches and whatever to warp
Anywho, a blind Amnesia playthrough?  Yeah... let's players back in the day weren't faking their reactions
I feel like he acts it up a bit these days whenever playing games, exagerrating his emotions
But playing Amnesia, I believe his moments were genuine
In the Choir Hall, there's an Iron Maiden in one of the rooms
When you walk near it, the doors suddenly fling open, the screen distorts a bit, there's a scream, a small blood mist flys out, and I genuinely jumped in my seat
I watched a walkthrough for the area and used the wiki, and even then the zone was gdamn terrifying
In particular, the area is terrifying because it's dark (though thankfully not the sanity draining type everywhere else)
There's a bit of fog, the developers drew inspiration from Silent Hill, that makes it a bit harder to see
Yeah, anything + dark is pretty freaky
The area is VERY open.  Most zones are claustrophobic and / or have lots of rooms to hide in
There are some rooms, but for the most part you just have a bunch of pillars
Adds to the fear of the unknown
Like when you‚Äôre swimming in deep water
yeah, I refuse to go out into the ocean ever :upside_down:
And the last bit is that this area is host to the more dangerous type of enemy found in the game called the Brute
New Patreon Post: Maid Outfit Kathrin https://www.patreon.com/posts/maid-outfit-38898602
So those monsters I linked are the most dangerous in order from least to most
Kaernk isn't that dangerous because it's only found in watery areas, you can tell where it is when it moves, and it can be distracted with meat
Yeah I‚Äôve seen the flappyface guy lol
He‚Äôs like their signature monster dude
That's the grunt.  You can outrun them and they take a few hits to kill you
I‚Äôve never deen the nightmare dolphin though
Yeah I kinda got the effect that he‚Äôs like always just kind of stalking you
or at least shortly after you start exploring
Is he the most encountered or no?
The guy with the weird mouth and mostly normal head is the signature monster
The one with no eyes reminds me a bit of uh... the Clickers from The Last of Us
That's the Brute, the most dangerous enemy
The Gatherer's aren't the brightest, they fulfill the "dumb guard" role
They might investigate an area, but do it very half-assed and quickly
In Hard Mode they apparently are closer to the Brute in thoroughness
Fun fact about the Kaernk, it's model is a ball
But like I said, they can be distracted and / or "killed"
More thoroughness, sounds like the AI for a roomba
I think when you "kill" them, you're just forcing their model through the floor of the map and then the game doesn't really know what to do with them
But outside of knowing how to "kill" them, if there's any meat lying around in a room, you can toss it off into some corner and wait for the kaernk to start eating it
Yeah they say that, lots of times the models aren‚Äôt discharged from RAM just stored somewherer else for it to pop up
The Brute is the most dangerous enemy in the game, though
They run faster than Daniel, can kill you in one hit, even at full health, and they *actually* investigate
And the Choir Hall has up to 6 of them that will spawn
I legit almost gave myself a heart attack when doing that room
Even following the walkthrough video, a servant grunt spawned that I wasn't expecting, I turn around and start retracing my steps, and then I come face to face with the dang thing
Somehow the brute didn't spot me and I was able to slink away with my heart going nuts
So yeah, I stand by my statement, Amnesia is terrifying
Even with the wiki and walkthroughs, I was able to get terrified
Rightly so, yeah tough not to become immersed
Makes me wonder if I'll be able to finish Alien: Isolation
To give you an idea of how much time I'd have to respend in Amnesia to get those achievements
I finished the game, and it only took 9 hours
I'd be spending maybe an extra hour at most to restart from just before completing the orb
That‚Äôs decent playtime for a game like that
Portal 1‚Äôs campagine was about that and that started as an indie-type effort
Yup.  I looked at my time played and just went, "Really???"
I finished this game over 2 weeks
And it did not feel like 9 hours, lol
In Amnesia, when a monster spawns, it's because it was scripted
It'll explore for a bit, but if it doesn't find anything it'll despawn
A Machine for Pigs had a bit more permanence.  They patrolled a small area, but once you got past them, you were good
That said, holy eff were the Tesla Pigs terrifying :ptv-shock:
From the looks of it, SOMA's monsters are permanent
They're attached to certain areas and move about.  You just have to avoid them
